simulator

Class SimulatorEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • prism.PrismComponent
      • simulator.SimulatorEngine

  • public class SimulatorEngine
extends PrismComponent
    A discrete event simulation engine for PRISM models. The SimulatorEngine class provides support for:
    • State/model exploration
    • Manual/random path generation
    • Monte-Carlo sampling techniques for approximate property verification
    After creating a SimulatorEngine object, you can build paths or explore models using:
    • createNewPath(parser.ast.ModulesFile) if you want to create a path that will be stored in full
    • createNewOnTheFlyPath(parser.ast.ModulesFile) if just want to do e.g. model exploration
    The input to these methods is a model (ModulesFile) in which all constants have already been defined. At this point, you can also load labels and properties into the simulator, whose values will be available during path generation. Use:
    • addLabel(parser.ast.Expression)
    • addProperty(parser.ast.Expression)
    To actually initialise the path with an initial state (or to reinitialise later) use:
    • initialisePath(parser.State)
    For sampling-based approximate model checking, use:
    • isPropertyOKForSimulation(parser.ast.Expression)
    • checkPropertyForSimulation(parser.ast.Expression)
    • modelCheckSingleProperty(parser.ast.ModulesFile, parser.ast.PropertiesFile, parser.ast.Expression, parser.State, long, simulator.method.SimulationMethod)
    • modelCheckMultipleProperties(parser.ast.ModulesFile, parser.ast.PropertiesFile, java.util.List<parser.ast.Expression>, parser.State, long, simulator.method.SimulationMethod)
    • modelCheckExperiment(parser.ast.ModulesFile, parser.ast.PropertiesFile, prism.UndefinedConstants, prism.ResultsCollection, parser.ast.Expression, parser.State, long, simulator.method.SimulationMethod)

        public void checkModelForSimulation(ModulesFile modulesFile)
                             throws PrismException
        Check whether a model is suitable for exploration/analysis using the simulator. If not, an explanatory error message is thrown as an exception.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • manualTransition

        public void manualTransition(int index)
                      throws PrismException
        Execute a transition from the current transition list, specified by its index within the (whole) list. If this is a continuous-time model, the time to be spent in the state before leaving is picked randomly.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • manualTransition

        public void manualTransition(int index,
                             double time)
                      throws PrismException
        Execute a transition from the current transition list, specified by its index within the (whole) list. In addition, specify the amount of time to be spent in the current state before this transition occurs. [continuous-time models only]
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • automaticTransition

        public boolean automaticTransition()
                            throws PrismException
        Select, at random, a transition from the current transition list and execute it. For continuous-time models, the time to be spent in the state before leaving is also picked randomly. If there is currently a deadlock, no transition is taken and the function returns false. Otherwise, the function returns true indicating that a transition was successfully taken.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • automaticTransitions

        public int automaticTransitions(int n,
                                boolean stopOnLoops)
                         throws PrismException
        Select, at random, n successive transitions and execute them. For continuous-time models, the time to be spent in each state before leaving is also picked randomly. If a deadlock is found, the process stops. Optionally, if a deterministic loop is detected, the process stops. The function returns the number of transitions successfully taken.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • automaticTransitions

        public int automaticTransitions(double time,
                                boolean stopOnLoops)
                         throws PrismException
        Randomly select and execute transitions until the specified time delay is first exceeded. (Time is measured from the initial execution of this method, not total time.) (For discrete-time models, this just results in ceil(time) steps being executed.) If a deadlock is found, the process stops. The function returns the number of transitions successfully taken.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • backtrackTo

        public void backtrackTo(int step)
                 throws PrismException
        Backtrack to a particular step within the current path. Time point should be >=0 and <= the total path size. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths)
        Parameters:
        step - The step to backtrack to.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • backtrackTo

        public void backtrackTo(double time)
                 throws PrismException
        Backtrack to a particular (continuous) time point within the current path. Time point should be >=0 and <= the total path time. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths)
        Parameters:
        time - The amount of time to backtrack.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • removePrecedingStates

        public void removePrecedingStates(int step)
                           throws PrismException
        Remove the prefix of the current path up to the given path step. Index step should be >=0 and <= the total path size. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths)
        Parameters:
        step - The step before which state will be removed.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeTransitionsForStep

        public void computeTransitionsForStep(int step)
                               throws PrismException
        Compute the transition table for an earlier step in the path. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths) If you do this mid-path, don't forget to reset the transition table with computeTransitionsForCurrentState because this is not kept track of by the simulator.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • loadPath

        public void loadPath(ModulesFile modulesFile,
                     PathFullInfo newPath)
              throws PrismException
        Construct a path through a model to match a supplied path, specified as a PathFullInfo object. Note: All constants in the model must have already been defined.
        Parameters:
        modulesFile - Model for simulation
        newPath - Path to match
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • addLabel

        public int addLabel(Expression label)
             throws PrismLangException
        Add a label to the simulator, whose value will be computed during path generation. The resulting index of the label is returned: this is used for later queries about the property. Any constants/formulas etc. appearing in the label must have been defined in the current model. If there are additional constants (e.g. from a properties file), then use the addLabel(Expression, PropertiesFile) method.
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • addLabel

        public int addLabel(Expression label,
                    PropertiesFile pf)
             throws PrismLangException
        Add a label to the simulator, whose value will be computed during path generation. The resulting index of the label is returned: this is used for later queries about the property. Any constants/formulas etc. appearing in the label must have been defined in the current model or be supplied in the (optional) passed in PropertiesFile.
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • addProperty

        public int addProperty(Expression prop)
                throws PrismException
        Add a (path) property to the simulator, whose value will be computed during path generation. The resulting index of the property is returned: this is used for later queries about the property. Any constants/formulas etc. appearing in the label must have been defined in the current model. If there are additional constants (e.g. from a properties file), then use the addProperty(Expression, PropertiesFile) method.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • addProperty

        public int addProperty(Expression prop,
                       PropertiesFile pf)
                throws PrismException
        Add a (path) property to the simulator, whose value will be computed during path generation. The resulting index of the property is returned: this is used for later queries about the property. Any constants/formulas etc. appearing in the property must have been defined in the current model or be supplied in the (optional) passed in PropertiesFile. In case of error, the property is not added an exception is thrown.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • loadModulesFile

        private void loadModulesFile(ModulesFile modulesFile)
                      throws PrismException
        Loads a new PRISM model into the simulator.
        Parameters:
        modulesFile - The parsed PRISM model
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • executeTransition

        private void executeTransition(int i,
                               int offset,
                               int index)
                        throws PrismException
        Execute a transition from the current transition list and update path (if being stored). Transition is specified by index of its choice and offset within it. If known, its index (within the whole list) can optionally be specified (since this may be needed for storage in the path). If this is -1, it will be computed automatically if needed.
        Parameters:
        i - Index of choice containing transition to execute
        offset - Index within choice of transition to execute
        index - (Optionally) index of transition within whole list (-1 if unknown)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • executeTimedTransition

        private void executeTimedTransition(int i,
                                    int offset,
                                    double time,
                                    int index)
                             throws PrismException
        Execute a (timed) transition from the current transition list and update path (if being stored). Transition is specified by index of its choice and offset within it. If known, its index (within the whole list) can optionally be specified (since this may be needed for storage in the path). If this is -1, it will be computed automatically if needed. In addition, the amount of time to be spent in the current state before this transition occurs should be specified. [continuous-time models only]
        Parameters:
        i - Index of choice containing transition to execute
        offset - Index within choice of transition to execute
        time - Time for transition
        index - (Optionally) index of transition within whole list (-1 if unknown)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • resetSamplers

        private void resetSamplers()
                    throws PrismLangException
        Reset samplers for any loaded properties.
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

                     throws PrismException

        Throws:
        PrismException

      • recomputeSamplers

        private void recomputeSamplers()
                        throws PrismLangException
        Recompute the state of samplers for any loaded properties based on the whole current path. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths)
        Throws:
        PrismLangException

      • getIndexOfVar

        public int getIndexOfVar(java.lang.String name)
                  throws PrismException
        Returns the index of a variable name, as stored by the simulator for the current model. Returns -1 if the action name does not exist.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionList

        public TransitionList getTransitionList()
                                 throws PrismException
        Returns the current list of available transitions, generating it first if this has not yet been done. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionListState

        public State getTransitionListState()
        Get the state for which the simulator is currently supplying information about its transitions. Usually, this is the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be this state instead.

      • getNumChoices

        public int getNumChoices()
                  throws PrismException
        Returns the current number of available choices. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getNumTransitions

        public int getNumTransitions()
                      throws PrismException
        Returns the current (total) number of available transitions. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getNumTransitions

        public int getNumTransitions(int i)
                      throws PrismException
        Returns the current number of available transitions in choice i. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getChoiceIndexOfTransition

        public int getChoiceIndexOfTransition(int index)
                               throws PrismException
        Get the index of the choice containing a transition of a given index. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionModuleOrAction

        public java.lang.String getTransitionModuleOrAction(int i,
                                                    int offset)
                                             throws PrismException
        Get a string describing the action/module of a transition, specified by its index/offset. (form is "module" or "[action]") Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionModuleOrAction

        public java.lang.String getTransitionModuleOrAction(int index)
                                             throws PrismException
        Get a string describing the action/module of a transition, specified by its index. (form is "module" or "[action]") Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionModuleOrActionIndex

        public int getTransitionModuleOrActionIndex(int i,
                                            int offset)
                                     throws PrismException
        Get the index of the action/module of a transition, specified by its index/offset. (-i for independent in ith module, i for synchronous on ith action) (in both cases, modules/actions are 1-indexed) Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionModuleOrActionIndex

        public int getTransitionModuleOrActionIndex(int index)
                                     throws PrismException
        Get the index of the action/module of a transition, specified by its index. (-i for independent in ith module, i for synchronous on ith action) (in both cases, modules/actions are 1-indexed) Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionAction

        public java.lang.String getTransitionAction(int i,
                                            int offset)
                                     throws PrismException
        Get the action label of a transition as a string, specified by its index/offset. (null for asynchronous/independent transitions) (see also getTransitionModuleOrAction(int, int) and getTransitionModuleOrActionIndex(int, int)) Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionAction

        public java.lang.String getTransitionAction(int index)
                                     throws PrismException
        Get the action label of a transition as a string, specified by its index. (null for asynchronous/independent transitions) (see also getTransitionModuleOrAction(int) and getTransitionModuleOrActionIndex(int)) Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionProbability

        public double getTransitionProbability(int i,
                                       int offset)
                                throws PrismException
        Get the probability/rate of a transition within a choice, specified by its index/offset. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionProbability

        public double getTransitionProbability(int index)
                                throws PrismException
        Get the probability/rate of a transition, specified by its index. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionUpdateString

        public java.lang.String getTransitionUpdateString(int index)
                                           throws PrismException
        Get a string describing the updates making up a transition, specified by its index. This is in abbreviated form, i.e. x'=1, rather than x'=x+1. Format is: x'=1, y'=0, with empty string for empty update. Only variables updated are included in list (even if unchanged). Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getTransitionUpdateStringFull

        public java.lang.String getTransitionUpdateStringFull(int index)
                                               throws PrismException
        Get a string describing the updates making up a transition, specified by its index. This is in full, i.e. of the form x'=x+1, rather than x'=1. Format is: (x'=x+1) & (y'=y-1), with empty string for empty update. Only variables updated are included in list. Note that expressions may have been simplified from original model. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeTransitionTarget

        public State computeTransitionTarget(int i,
                                     int offset)
                              throws PrismException
        Get the target (as a new State object) of a transition within a choice, specified by its index/offset. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • computeTransitionTarget

        public State computeTransitionTarget(int index)
                              throws PrismException
        Get the target of a transition (as a new State object), specified by its index. Usually, this is for the current (final) state of the path but, if you called computeTransitionsForStep(int step), it will be for this state instead.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getPath

        public Path getPath()
        Get access to the Path object storing the current path. This object is only valid until the next time createNewPath(parser.ast.ModulesFile) is called.

      • getPathSize

        public long getPathSize()
        Get the size of the current path (number of steps; or number of states - 1).

      • getCurrentState

        public State getCurrentState()
        Returns the current state being explored by the simulator.

      • getPreviousState

        public State getPreviousState()
        Returns the previous state of the current path in the simulator.

      • getTotalTimeForPath

        public double getTotalTimeForPath()
        Get the total time elapsed so far (where zero time has been spent in the current (final) state). For discrete-time models, this is just the number of steps (but returned as a double).

      • getTotalCumulativeRewardForPath

        public double getTotalCumulativeRewardForPath(int rsi)
        Get the total reward accumulated so far (includes reward for previous transition but no state reward for current (final) state).
        Parameters:
        rsi - Reward structure index

      • getPathFull

        public PathFull getPathFull()
        Get access to the PathFull object storing the current path. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths) This object is only valid until the next time createNewPath(parser.ast.ModulesFile) is called.

      • getVariableValueOfPathStep

                                                   int varIndex)
        Get the value of a variable at a given step of the path. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths)
        Parameters:
        step - Step index (0 = initial state/step of path)
        varIndex - The index of the variable to look up

      • getModuleOrActionIndexOfPathStep

        public int getModuleOrActionIndexOfPathStep(int step)
        Get the index i of the action taken for a given step. If i>0, then i-1 is the index of an action label (0-indexed) If i<0, then -i-1 is the index of a module (0-indexed) (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths)
        Parameters:
        step - Step index (0 = initial state/step of path)

      • getModuleOrActionOfPathStep

        public boolean isPathLooping()
        Check whether the current path is in a deterministic loop.

        Get at which step a deterministic loop (if present) ends.

                throws PrismException
        Export the current path to a file in a simple space separated format. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths)
        Parameters:
        file - File to which the path should be exported to (mainLog if null).
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • exportPath

        public void exportPath(java.io.File file,
                       boolean timeCumul,
                       java.lang.String colSep,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> vars)
                throws PrismException
        Export the current path to a file. (Not applicable for on-the-fly paths)
        Parameters:
        file - File to which the path should be exported to (mainLog if null).
        timeCumul - Show time in cumulative form?
        colSep - String used to separate columns in display
        vars - Restrict printing to these variables (indices) and steps which change them (ignore if null)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • isPropertyOKForSimulation

        public boolean isPropertyOKForSimulation(Expression expr)
        Check whether a property is suitable for approximate model checking using the simulator.

      • checkPropertyForSimulation

        public void checkPropertyForSimulation(Expression expr)
                                throws PrismException
        Check whether a property is suitable for approximate model checking using the simulator. If not, an explanatory error message is thrown as an exception.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • isPropertyOKForSimulationString

        private java.lang.String isPropertyOKForSimulationString(Expression expr)
        Check whether a property is suitable for approximate model checking using the simulator. If yes, return null; if not, return an explanatory error message.

      • modelCheckSingleProperty

        public java.lang.Object modelCheckSingleProperty(ModulesFile modulesFile,
                                                 PropertiesFile propertiesFile,
                                                 Expression expr,
                                                 State initialState,
                                                 long maxPathLength,
                                                 SimulationMethod simMethod)
                                          throws PrismException
        Perform approximate model checking of a property on a model, using the simulator. Sampling starts from the initial state provided or, if null, the default initial state is used, selecting randomly (each time) if there are more than one. Returns a Result object, except in case of error, where an Exception is thrown. Note: All constants in the model/property files must have already been defined.
        Parameters:
        modulesFile - Model for simulation, constants defined
        propertiesFile - Properties file containing property to check, constants defined
        expr - The property to check
        initialState - Initial state (if null, is selected randomly)
        maxPathLength - The maximum path length for sampling
        simMethod - Object specifying details of method to use for simulation
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • modelCheckMultipleProperties

        public java.lang.Object[] modelCheckMultipleProperties(ModulesFile modulesFile,
                                                       PropertiesFile propertiesFile,
                                                       java.util.List<Expression> exprs,
                                                       State initialState,
                                                       long maxPathLength,
                                                       SimulationMethod simMethod)
                                                throws PrismException
        Perform approximate model checking of properties on a model, using the simulator. Sampling starts from the initial state provided or, if null, the default initial state is used, selecting randomly (each time) if there are more than one. Returns an array of results, some of which may be Exception objects if there were errors. In the case of an error which affects all properties, an exception is thrown. Note: All constants in the model/property files must have already been defined.
        Parameters:
        modulesFile - Model for simulation, constants defined
        propertiesFile - Properties file containing property to check, constants defined
        exprs - The properties to check
        initialState - Initial state (if null, is selected randomly)
        maxPathLength - The maximum path length for sampling
        simMethod - Object specifying details of method to use for simulation
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • modelCheckExperiment

        public void modelCheckExperiment(ModulesFile modulesFile,
                                 PropertiesFile propertiesFile,
                                 UndefinedConstants undefinedConstants,
                                 ResultsCollection resultsCollection,
                                 Expression expr,
                                 State initialState,
                                 long maxPathLength,
                                 SimulationMethod simMethod)
                          throws PrismException,
                                 java.lang.InterruptedException
        Perform an approximate model checking experiment on a model, using the simulator (specified by values for undefined constants from the property only). Sampling starts from the initial state provided or, if null, the default initial state is used, selecting randomly (each time) if there are more than one. Results are stored in the ResultsCollection object passed in, some of which may be Exception objects if there were errors. In the case of an error which affects all properties, an exception is thrown. Note: All constants in the model file must have already been defined.
        Parameters:
        modulesFile - Model for simulation, constants defined
        propertiesFile - Properties file containing property to check, constants defined
        undefinedConstants - Details of constant ranges defining the experiment
        resultsCollection - Where to store the results
        expr - The property to check
        initialState - Initial state (if null, is selected randomly)
        maxPathLength - The maximum path length for sampling
        simMethod - Object specifying details of method to use for simulation
        Throws:
        PrismException - if something goes wrong with the sampling algorithm
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

      • doSampling

        private void doSampling(State initialState,
                        long maxPathLength)
                 throws PrismException
        Execute sampling for the set of currently loaded properties. Sample paths are from the specified initial state and maximum length. Termination of the sampling process occurs when the SimulationMethod object for all properties indicate that it is finished.
        Parameters:
        initialState - Initial state (if null, is selected randomly)
        maxPathLength - The maximum path length for sampling
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • stopSampling

        public void stopSampling()
        Halt the sampling algorithm in its tracks (not implemented).
